cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles WSW of the Dry Tortugas, or 125 miles N of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Meandering over the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, then a slow turn north and northeast toward the Florida Gulf Coast later this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast of Florida near the Cedar Key / Big Bend area

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and central Florida peninsula (including Keys and southeast coast) experiencing gusty winds, heavy rain and coastal swells
weather_observation.wind: Intermittent tropical-storm-force gusts possible (sustained winds mostly below 34 kt)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding and elevated seas below 3 ft possible along the Atlantic beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 1â€“3 inches with locally higher totals; saturated ground could lead to urban flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas that could disrupt vessel movements and bunkering operations
